bibl.title: A Ptolemaic Portrait in Athens.
Proceedings of the 3rd Symposium on Ancient Greek and Related Pottery. Copenhagen, August 31-September 4, 1987

bibl.note: Athens, Agora Excavations P 747 and P 16626. Emblem clay cups, ca 275 B.C. The emblemata represent a portrait of Ptolemy I or II, and reflect the popularity of the Ptolemies in Athens between 287 and the 260's.
bibl.seg: Rotroff Susan I., A Ptolemaic Portrait in Athens.
Proceedings of the 3rd Symposium on Ancient Greek and Related Pottery. Copenhagen, August 31-September 4, 1987 (Copenhagen, 1988) pp. 516-523, 7 figg.
